Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameControllerExpertMode
public class GameController extends Object implements Serializable
This server-side class controls the game flow of a game in Normal mode towards all of its phases, from its creation to the winner's declaration. Each Game has its own game controller, which regulates the flow of every event.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    startGame()
    Starts the game by setting the game state to IN_GAME, arranging the Game model for the first round according to Eriantys' rules and broadcasting a proper message to all the participant players.
    void
    winCheck()
    Instantly ends the game if there are less than four islands on the game board, if a player has emptied its tower room or if the round number 10 has ended.

      Returns:

      Sets the boolean flag to true if the current player has moved Mother Nature, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      motherNatureMoved - the new flag.

      public void setPlayerPlanningPhaseDone(boolean playerPlanningPhaseDone)

    • getCurrentPlayerIndex

      public int getCurrentPlayerIndex()
      Returns the current player's index.
      Returns:
      the int corresponding to the current player's index in the list of players (starting from 0).

    • setCurrentPlayerIndex

      public void setCurrentPlayerIndex(int currentPlayerIndex)
      Sets the current player's index (when a player ends a game phase, its index is overwritten by the next player's index).
      Parameters:
      currentPlayerIndex - the new index.

    • getVirtualViewMap

      public Map<String,VirtualView> getVirtualViewMap()
      Returns the map that contains the VirtualView associated to each player/client.
      Returns:
      the Map that contains a VirtualView for each nickname associated to a player.

    • getMessage

      public void getMessage(Message receivedMessage) throws TryAgainException
      Receives a message from a client and executes different actions according to the message's type and according to which state is the game in: adding players to the queue (state SETUP) or modifying parts of the model (state IN_GAME).
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      TryAgainException - if an exception cannot be caught by the controller, it is caught by the Server class.

    • goToSetupPhase

      public void goToSetupPhase()
      Sets the game's state to SETUP.

    • prepareGame

      public void prepareGame(int playerNum)
      Creates the game instance according to the number of players and to the specific (sub)class of the controller.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - the given number of players.

    • addPlayerToQueue

      public void addPlayerToQueue(String nickname, VirtualView virtualView)
      Adds the nickname chosen by a client in a queue. The queue contains the nickname of the clients before they communicate their WizardID.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the client.
      virtualView - the VirtualView associated to the client.

    • removePlayerFromQueue

      public void removePlayerFromQueue(String nickname)
      Removes a player from the queue (given the nickname).
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to remove.

    • addPlayerToGame

      public void addPlayerToGame(Message receivedMessage)
      Adds a player to the game once they have chosen a unique WizardID and sent it via a message. The WizardID will be asked until a unique one is chosen.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by setting the game state to IN_GAME, arranging the Game model for the first round according to Eriantys' rules and broadcasting a proper message to all the participant players.

    • planningPhase

      public void planningPhase(Message message) throws WrongMessageSentException
      Allows the current player to play his Planning Phase properly.
      Parameters:
      message - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      WrongMessageSentException

    • nextPlayerPlanningPhase

      public void nextPlayerPlanningPhase()
      Allows the next player to play his Planning Phase properly by resetting some controller's variables.

    • endPlanningPhase

      public void endPlanningPhase()
      Sets the controller's variables and the players' order so that the first player of the current round's Action Phase can play properly.

    • actionPhase

      public void actionPhase(Message message) throws TryAgainException
      Establishes the right flow of the current player's Action Phase by using the controller's variables.
      Parameters:
      message - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      TryAgainException - if an exception cannot be caught by the controller, it is caught by the Server class.

    • nextPlayerActionPhase

      public void nextPlayerActionPhase()
      Resets the controller's variables in order to let the next player play his Action Phase properly.

    • nextRound

      public void nextRound()
      Sets the controller's variables in order to let the players play the next round properly. If the game board's students' bag is empty, instantly ends the game.

    • handleAssistantCardChoice

      public void handleAssistantCardChoice(Message receivedMessage)
      Allows the current player to play the chosen Assistant Card, if it is playable: in the case it is, all the other players will be notified; otherwise, the current player will be asked to choose another one.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.

    • isAssistantCardPlayable

      public boolean isAssistantCardPlayable(String cardName)
      Checks if an Assistant Card is playable by a specific player.
      Parameters:
      cardName - the name of the chosen card.
      Returns:
      true if the chosen card is playable, false otherwise.

    • setOrder

      public void setOrder()
      Establishes the new players' order according to the Assistant Cards played, then sets the model accordingly.

    • handleStudentMovement

      public void handleStudentMovement(Message receivedMessage) throws FullTableException, StudentNotFoundException, NonExistentColorException, IslandNotFoundException
      Handles the movement of a student, as desired by the current player. According to the choice made, it may be moved to its table or to a specified island. The color of the student to move is specified in the message received from the client. If no exception is thrown, every player (except the current one) will be notified.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      FullTableException - if the table of the specified color is full.
      StudentNotFoundException - if the current player has no student of the specified color in the hall.
      NonExistentColorException - if a non-existent color is somehow encapsulated in the message.
      IslandNotFoundException - if the specified island ID is not associated to any of the currently existing islands.

    • handleMotherNature

      public void handleMotherNature(Message receivedMessage) throws InvalidNumberOfStepsException, IslandNotFoundException
      Handles Mother Nature's movement, as desired by the current player. If no exception is thrown, every player (except the current one) will be notified.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      InvalidNumberOfStepsException - if the current player asks Mother Nature to move of too many steps (or of less than one).
      IslandNotFoundException - if a non-existent island is somehow (trying to be) reached.

    • handleCloudChoice

      public void handleCloudChoice(Message receivedMessage) throws EmptyCloudException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Handles the current player's cloud choice at the end of their Action Phase, allowing them to empty one. If no exception is thrown, every player (except the current one) will be notified.
      Parameters:
      receivedMessage - the message sent by the client.
      Throws:
      EmptyCloudException - if the chosen cloud has already been emptied.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the ID specified in the message does not exist.

    • winCheck

      public void winCheck()
      Instantly ends the game if there are less than four islands on the game board, if a player has emptied its tower room or if the round number 10 has ended.

    • noTowersLeftCheck

      public boolean noTowersLeftCheck()
      Checks if the current player has no towers left in their school.
      Returns:
      true if the current player's tower hall has no tower, false otherwise.

    • isStudentBagEmpty

      public boolean isStudentBagEmpty()
      Checks if the game's students' bag is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the game's students' bag is empty, false otherwise.

    • lessThanFourIslandsCheck

      public boolean lessThanFourIslandsCheck()
      Checks if the game board's archipelagos has less than four islands.
      Returns:
      true if the game board's archipelagos has less than four islands, false otherwise.

    • declareWinningPlayer

      public void declareWinningPlayer() throws TieException
      Honors the player that has won the game. The player who wins the game is the player who has the fewer amount of towers left in their tower room. In case of tie, the winning player is the one with the biggest amount of professors. In the very rare case of another tie, there's no winning player, and an exception is thrown.
      Throws:
      TieException

    • broadcastGenericMessage

      public void broadcastGenericMessage(String message)
      Broadcasts a generic message to all the players connected to the game.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to broadcast to the players.

    • broadcastDisconnectionMessage

      public void broadcastDisconnectionMessage(String message)
      Broadcasts a disconnection message to all the players still connected to the game. Please remember that the disconnection of a player causes the instant end of the game with no player declared winner, but all the players who are still connected to the server may choose whether to create a new game or to join an existing one.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to broadcast to the connected players.

    • broadcastWaitingMessage

      public void broadcastWaitingMessage()
      Broadcasts a waiting message to all the players who are not playing at the moment.

    • broadcastUpdateMessage

      public void broadcastUpdateMessage(String message)
      Notifies all the players (except for the current player) of the current players' latest action.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to broadcast to the players.

    • broadcastPhaseUpdate

      public void broadcastPhaseUpdate(boolean isActionPhase)
      Notifies all the players of a phase change.
      Parameters:
      isActionPhase - true if the new current phase is the Action Phase, false otherwise.

    • broadcastGameStatusFirstActionPhase

      public void broadcastGameStatusFirstActionPhase()
      Broadcasts the game board plus useful information about the last Planning Phase (and the consequent players' order) to all the players.

    • broadcastGameBoard

      public void broadcastGameBoard()
      Broadcasts the game board to all the players.

    • showDeck

      public void showDeck(VirtualView virtualView)
      Shows to the specified VirtualView the associated player's Assistant Card deck.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - the VirtualView to send the deck to.

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Ends the game by closing the client apps and removing the game controller from the Server.
